page.title: 14Nant-y-Ffrith
page.content: Nant-y-Ffrith means "The brook beneath the mountain pasture." It is a valley with a large stream running through it. The woods in Nant-y-Ffrith consist mainly of coniferous trees mixed with some broad-leaved trees. Many conifers have been planted in recent years. Rhododendron bushes are spreading thoughout the valley and an attempt is now being made to control their growth. In the valley are the remains of a large hall, some lodges and a coach house. Also in the valley are some caves known as the{Wedding Caves.}Easy access for the public has been made by the construction of steps, footbridges and pathways. The valley is renowned throughout the area for its rich variety of wildlife and plantlife. {
